summary: This is a court order from Judge Kenneth A. Marra denying motions by Jane Doe 3 and Jane Doe 4 to join a Crime Victims' Rights Act (CVRA) lawsuit against the U.S. Government regarding the Jeffrey Epstein non-prosecution agreement. The order also denies Alan Dershowitz's motion to intervene and strikes detailed allegations about Epstein's alleged sex trafficking of Jane Doe 3 to prominent individuals as 'impertinent' to the core CVRA claim.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the non-prosecution agreement (NPA) with the government. The petitioners allege he subjected them to sexual crimes while they were minors.

persons.name: Alan M. Dershowitz
persons.context: Sought limited intervention to strike 'outrageous and impertinent allegations' made against him in the filings. His motion was denied as moot after the court struck the details itself.

persons.name: Kenneth A. Marra
persons.context: The judge who authored the order, denying the motions to join and amend, and striking specific allegations from the record.

persons.name: Jane Doe 1
persons.context: One of the two original unnamed petitioners alleging the government violated their CVRA rights in the Epstein NPA.

persons.name: Jane Doe 2
persons.context: One of the two original unnamed petitioners alleging the government violated their CVRA rights in the Epstein NPA.

persons.name: Jane Doe 3
persons.context: An unnamed victim who sought to join the lawsuit. Her motion included detailed proffers about being trafficked by Epstein to high-profile individuals, which the court ordered stricken.

persons.name: Jane Doe 4
persons.context: An unnamed victim who sought to join the lawsuit. Her proffer was limited to sexual acts with Epstein and was not stricken.

connections.description: Jane Doe 3 alleges Jeffrey Epstein sexually abused and trafficked her.
Jane Doe 4 alleges Jeffrey Epstein sexually abused her.
Jane Doe 1 alleges Jeffrey Epstein subjected her to sexual crimes while she was a minor.
Jane Doe 2 alleges Jeffrey Epstein subjected her to sexual crimes while she was a minor.
Dershowitz moved to intervene to strike allegations made against him in filings related to Jane Doe 3's proffers.

events.title: CVRA Lawsuit Filed
events.description: Jane Doe 1 and Jane Doe 2 initiate an action under the Crime Victims' Rights Act (CVRA) against the U.S. Government regarding the Epstein non-prosecution agreement.

events.title: Motion to Join Filed
events.description: Jane Doe 3 and Jane Doe 4 file a motion to join the existing CVRA lawsuit as petitioners.

events.title: Court Denies Motions to Join and Amend
events.description: Judge Kenneth A. Marra issues an order denying the motions by Jane Doe 3 and Jane Doe 4 to join the lawsuit and amend the petition.

locations: West Palm Beach, Palm Beach County, Florida
keyFacts: The court denied Jane Doe 3 and Jane Doe 4's attempt to join a CVRA lawsuit, finding their participation as named parties unnecessary since they could serve as fact witnesses for the existing 'similarly-situated victims' claim.

The court ordered large portions of Jane Doe 3's allegations—which detailed her being trafficked by Epstein to 'prominent American politicians, powerful business executives, foreign presidents, a well-known Prime Minister, and other world leaders'—stricken from the record as 'immaterial and impertinent' to the core CVRA claim.
Alan Dershowitz's motion to intervene to strike allegations against him was denied as moot because the court had already struck the offending material on its own authority under Rule 12(f).
The court noted the Government's argument that Jane Doe 4 might not be a proper party because she was not a 'known victim' at the time of the NPA and thus may not have CVRA standing.

The underlying lawsuit alleges the U.S. Government violated victims' rights under the CVRA by concealing and failing to consult with them before negotiating a non-prosecution agreement with Jeffrey Epstein.
